articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Newly Built Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Newly Built Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to Pyongyang Orphans' Primary School which provides the best environment for education and living conditions.
					 He went round the school building, hostel and other places to learn in detail about the construction and preparations for operating the school.
					
					 Pleased that the school building was built in a modern and fashionable style, he said that all classrooms were put on a multi-functional and IT basis to suit the features of primary education and equipped with varieties of teaching facilities.
					
					 He noted that the school has well-furnished room for the education in Kim Jong Il's patriotism, room for the members of the Children's Union, nature study room, music and dance room, etc. and all its spaces are devoted to acquiring knowledge and common sense as the corridor is decorated with diverse paintings and other things which attract children's interest and ensure visual, scientific and vivid effect.
					
					 Visiting Second-Year Class A having Korean language lesson, he learned in detail with fatherly care about how pupils are taught and how teaching aids are used, their cognition ability and the quality of their textbooks and notebooks.
					
					 Noting that the hostel was built in such way that it not only suits children's minds but enables them to live without any inconveniences, he added that he was satisfied with everything such as bedrooms and dining room, barber's and clinic.
					
					 The quality of the country's overall education including higher education depends on the quality of primary and secondary education and a shortcut to building a talented nation lies in thoroughly implementing the Party's policy of prioritizing primary and secondary education, he said, giving important instructions which would serve as guidelines for managing and operating the school.
					
					 He earnestly asked the officials and the teaching staff of the school to take good care of its pupils, reflecting his wish, so that they may grow up uprightly, stoutly and cheerfully without the slightest sadness and worry as orphans have our Party only to trust and depend on.
					
					 He had a photo session with the pupils and teaching staff of Pyongyang Orphans' Primary and Secondary schools and builders.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., the WPK, Jo Yong Won, vice department director of the C.C., WPK, and Ma Won Chun, director of the Designing Department of the State Affairs Commission.

articles.title: Greetings to New Chairman of AU Commission
articles.content:
Greetings to New Chairman of AU Commission
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Jan. 31 sent a message of greeting to Moussa Faki Mahamat on his election as chairman of the Commission of African Union (AU) at the 28th session of the assembly of heads of state and government of the AU.
					 The message said that his election is an expression of deep trust and expectation of the peoples in the region striving to settle the issues of African Continent independently without any outside interference and ensure the peace, stability and development of Africa.
					
					 It reaffirmed the DPRK's steadfast stand to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the AU and its member nations and wished the chairman great success in his responsible work for the strengthening of the AU.

articles.title: DPRK FM Sends Greetings to Vice-Chairperson of AU Commission
articles.content:
DPRK FM Sends Greetings to Vice-Chairperson of AU Commission
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK, on Feb. 1 sent a congratulatory message to Thomas Kwesi Quartey on being elected as vice-chairperson of the Commission of the African Union at the 28th session of the assembly of heads of state and government of the AU.
					 The message wished the Union and the vice-chairperson great success in their work to build independent, peaceful and prosperous Africa.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Kumsong Tractor Factory
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Kumsong Tractor Factory
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Kumsong Tractor Factory.
					 Going round various parts of the factory, he learned in detail about the preparations for serial production of 80 h.p. tractors and encouraged its workers to register bigger successes.
					
					 Then there took place a consultative meeting at which measures were taken to update the factory and solve the problems arising in the production.
					
					 The premier also visited the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex. He called for maintaining the generating equipment in a qualitative way and fulfilling daily and monthly plans for electricity production without fail.
					
					 Earlier, he inspected the Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Silk Mill and the Pyongyang Bag Factory where he took measures for boosting the production of consumer goods.

articles.title: New DPRK Ambassador to Switzerland Appointed
articles.content:
New DPRK Ambassador to Switzerland Appointed
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Han Tae Song has been appointed as DPRK ambassador to Switzerland, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Iranian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Iranian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received the credentials from Seyed Mohsen Emadi, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Should Ponder over DPRK's Patriotic Appeal: CPRC Spokesman
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Should Ponder over DPRK's Patriotic Appeal: CPRC Spokesman
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad ardently wish to see the inter-Korean relations improve and peace and stability settle on the Korean peninsula in response to the DPRK's new year's appeal for paving a broad avenue to independent reunification by polling their intention and efforts, said a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country (CPRC) of the DPRK in a statement issued on February 1.
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is, however, blowing the stereo-typed confrontation trumpet from the outset of the new year, bringing "north's denuclearization" and "its human rights issue" to the fore. It is crying out for establishing "a perfect alert posture" and taking "effective counteraction," vociferating about "north's threat" and "unpredictable provocation" every day, and busy making war drumbeats for invading the north everywhere.
					
					 We are well aware that "security crisis" much touted by the south Korean puppet regime, hyping " the north's threat and provocation", is aimed  at saving Park Geun Hye from the crisis of impeachment though she is hit hard from all sides.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities opt for reckless confrontation and provocation in a bid to put the alarming internal situation under control, this may spill over into an unimaginable conflict and war and eventually lead to their shameful destruction.
					
					 They will only suffer bitterer disgrace and humiliation if they blindly toe the U.S. line, failing to properly judge the rapidly changing situation in the neighboring countries and being unable to discern who is real principal enemy of the nation, accustomed to clinging to coattails of big powers. 
					
					 They should come to their senses and opt for carving out the independent destiny of the nation in response to the DPRK's offer of reconciliation before it is too late. This is the demand of all Koreans and the last advice of history.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities take the road of reckless confrontation and war in pursuance of the U.S. policy, defying the DPRK's sincere goodwill and appeal, the DPRK's tolerance and patience will go beyond their limit and in that case they will be held wholly accountable for the ensuing disastrous consequences.

articles.title: KJC Spokesman Hits U.S. for Justifying UNSC "Sanctions Resolutions" against DPRK
articles.content:
KJC Spokesman Hits U.S. for Justifying UNSC "Sanctions Resolutions" against DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Jurists Committee gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Thursday as regards the fact that the U.S. is letting out sophism to justify the UN Security Council's "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK:
					 All the anti-DPRK "sanctions resolutions", cooked up by the U.S. and its vassal forces so far by abusing the UN Security Council, have fully disclosed their illegality as they wantonly breached the legitimate right of a sovereign state and universally recognized international law.
					
					 The blockade-oriented "sanctions resolutions" against the DPRK, in particular, have drawn international censure as they are unethical actions going against civilization, acts aimed at totally denying the DPRK people's rights to existence and development and wrecking modern civilization and pushing the Korean society into darkness in the medieval age.
					
					 The "resolutions on sanctions" cooked up by the UN Security Council are devoid of legal ground and are in wanton violation of the legitimate rights of sovereign states and principles governing international relations provided for in the UN Charter. This was a conclusion drawn by the international judicial circle.
					
					 When the U.S. worked out in 1966 "sanctions resolution" 232, the first of its kind in UN history, under the pretext of Article 39 of the UN Charter to avenge former Rhodesia which declared its independence from Britain, the international judicial circle clarified the illegality of the "resolution," citing paragraph by paragraph, and took issue with the UN Security Council's act of going beyond its mandate.
					
					 Now the U.S. continues to cook up "resolutions" by abusing authority of the UN Security Council in defiance of universally recognized international law. In this regard, the DPRK requested the UN Secretariat to organize an international forum of law experts for clarifying the legal ground of those resolutions either in New York or in Geneva.
					
					 But the U.S. let experts on Korean affairs who lack knowledge about international law still spout hackneyed sophism that the UNSC is entitled to take appropriate measures if an act of specified country is seen as a threat to peace under Article 39 of the UN Charter and that the UNSC can impose sanctions because other countries do not accept the DPRK's withdrawal from the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty.
					
					 Article 39 of the UN Charter can not become a legal ground for the "sanctions resolution" as it provides for common authority of the UN Security Council, and no international law stipulates that nuclear test or satellite launch of a specified state constitutes threat to peace.
					
					 Moreover, the DPRK's withdrawal from the NPT was legitimate as it went through necessary procedures under Article 10 of the treaty and there is no paragraph in the treaty that specifies that withdrawal has to be recognized by other countries.
					
					 Flurry of sophism let out by so-called American experts on Korean affairs clearly proves the necessity of open discussion on legal grounds for "sanctions resolution" at an international forum of legal experts.
					
					 The UN advocating abidance by international law and regulations has to fulfill its responsibility and mission before the international community by organizing a forum immediately, properly meeting the just demand of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean Jurists Committee hopes that the international community and legal organizations valuing justice and truth would positively respond to the DPRK's proposal for organizing an international forum for open discussion on the legal grounds for "sanctions resolution".

articles.title: Peculiar Astronomical Phenomenon Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Peculiar Astronomical Phenomenon Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Observatory under the State Academy of Sciences observed a peculiar astronomical phenomenon in which the moon, Mars and Venus were placed in an almost beeline in the western sky from about 17:30 p.m. till about 21:00 p.m.
					 After the sunset in the west the moon rose and the Mars appeared between the moon and the Venus after the Venus was seen first in the oblique direction under the moon.
					
					 This phenomenon was seen more vividly from about 18:00 pm and then the azimuth and altitude of the moon, Mars and Venus were respectively 45.6 and 40.73, 50.83 and 38.98, 56.17 and 35.65 degrees.
					
					 The above-said phenomenon resulted from the movements of the revolution of Mars and Venus around the sun and the monthly revolution of the moon around the earth.
					
					 Experts say that the phenomenon of Mars and Venus nearing to each other is often seen but the above-said phenomenon is rare.

articles.title: Construction of Power Stations Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Construction of Power Stations Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address set forth a militant slogan to accelerate the victorious advance of socialism with the great spirit of self-reliance and self-development as the dynamic force.
					 In hearty response to his address, Jagang Province of the DPRK is speeding up the construction of 10-odd minor hydraulic power stations in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development from the outset of the year.
					
					 The provincial management bureau for minor hydraulic power stations has paid deep attention to supplying equipment and materials to the construction sites of power stations.
					
					 Builders of the Hungju Youth Power Station No. 4 completed a cofferdam within 25 days and got down to the grounding work for dam and generator room.
					
					 Builders of the Tokam Power Station in Wiwon County carried out the construction of waterway tunnel and equalizing tank. Now, they are pushing ahead with the construction of waterway, dam tamping and generator room on a full scale.
					
					 The same is true of the construction sites of the Usi Power Station No. 2, Chosan Power Station No. 4 and Hwaphyong Power Station No. 2.

articles.title: Group B Will Match for AFC Women's Asian Cup in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Group B Will Match for AFC Women's Asian Cup in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Group B matches for the AFC Women's Asian Cup Jordan 2018 Qualifiers will be held here from April 3 to 11.
					 According to the AFC's timetable, the DPRK team will compete with Indian team on April 3, Hong Kong of China on April 5, south Korean on April 7 and Uzbekistani on April 9. Preliminaries for qualification are to be held divided into 4 groups and only 8 teams including 4 winners from every group can take part in the AFC Women's Asian Cup slated for April 2018 in Jordan.
					
					 The DPRK team won the Asian trophy in 2001, 2003 and 2008. It also took the first place for 3 times in the women's football event of the Asian Games and won two consecutive victories in the EAFF Women's East Asia Cup.
					
					 It is expected that the DPRK team will have home-and-away matches as part of its preparation for qualification.

articles.title: Seminar in Field of Social Sciences Held
articles.content:
Seminar in Field of Social Sciences Held
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the peerlessly great persons' feats for development of the national language took place at the People's Palace of Culture here Thursday to mark the 70th anniversary of the establishment of the Linguistics Institute of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					 The seminar heard papers on the feats performed by the peerlessly great persons in leading the work to preserve and add luster to the spoken and written languages peculiar to the Korean nation and make the noble and civilized linguistic culture prevail throughout the society.
					
					 Speakers noted that President Kim Il Sung established the then Institute of Korean Language on Feb. 3, Juche 36 (1947) with insight into the importance and significance of developing the national language in stepping up the building of a new society.
					
					 They referred to the fact that the President built a center for specializing in the study of the Korean language and trained researchers and indicated important guidelines for developing it, thereby laying a basic groundwork for developing the mother tongue in a Juche-oriented manner.
					
					 And they explained and proved that he protected the most developed Korean letters from the Japanese imperialists' machinations to obliterate the spoken and written Korean language, shattered the moves of the anti-party, counter-revolutionary elements and laid a foundation for the Juche-oriented development of the Korean language.
					
					 They also recalled that leader Kim Jong Il upheld the linguistic ideas and theories and feats of the President and led the struggle to establish Juche in the linguistic life.
					
					 They stressed respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's idea that to establish the noble and civilized linguistic culture should be a firm tendency prevailing in our society serves as highly important guidelines to be held fast to in stepping up the building of a highly civilized and powerful socialist country.
					
					 The speakers expressed the will to preserve and add luster to the feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the development of the national language and make the fine cultured language of Korea contribute to building a powerful socialist country.

articles.title: Samjiyon Band Gives Performance in Wonsan
articles.content:
Samjiyon Band Gives Performance in Wonsan
Wonsan, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe started its performance in Wonsan City on Jan. 28.
					 The performance was enjoyed by officials, working people from all walks of life and youth and students in Kangwon Province.
					
					 Its numbers include male vocal solo and panchang "His Humanity", female vocal solo "Yearning Is My Happiness" and saxophone solo "Song of Sea".
					
					 The performers well represented the people's deep reverence and gratitude for respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who has translated their beautiful dreams and ideals into reality through his ceaseless field guidance.
					
					 Female vocal solo "Song of Big Fish Haul" and other numbers encouraged the working people of the province who are performing feats in the new year's drive to implement the five-year strategy for national economic development.
					
					 Mixed quartet "Girls' Song" and other numbers revved up the atmosphere of the performance.
					
					 The performance continues.

articles.title: Vietnamese Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Vietnamese Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Pham Viet Hung, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, on Thursday gave a reception at his embassy to mark the 67th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Vietnam.
					 Invited to it were officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					
					 Speakers expressed the will to value and steadily develop the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries, provided by President Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh, despite any change in the situation.

articles.title: U.S. Strategy for Sanctions against DPRK Never Works: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Strategy for Sanctions against DPRK Never Works: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. should roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK, well aware that neither its sanctions nor its blockade will be able to block the dynamic revolutionary advance of the DPRK, says Minju Joson Thursday in a commentary.
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that the U.S. has pursued the strategy for intensified sanctions with an aim at encroaching on the Korean people's right to existence, to say nothing of putting military pressure and threats.
					
					 However, though the DPRK has been hard pressed for everything and faced with ordeals and difficulties, its army and people have remained committed to their idea, social system and belief, it says, adding:
					
					 They, fully armed with the great idea and united as one in mind around their leader, have victoriously advanced the revolution, braving all difficulties with their indomitable efforts and will despite the desperate obstructive actions of the enemies.
					
					 Whenever they faced difficulties and ordeals, they never reached out to others for help but weathered them by themselves. And they raced against the time, true to the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 The great spirit of self-reliance and self-development serves as an ideological and moral source inspiring the army and people of the DPRK to a new victory.
					
					 They are now filled with the confidence that they will win the final victory without fail despite more severe ordeals and difficulties.
					
					 They will only record the history of victory in the future, too with the great spirit of self-reliance and self-development as the dynamic force.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Demands Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Demands Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Strong voices calling for the pullback of the U.S. forces from south Korea are heard from the U.S. Shortly ago, an American expert on Korean affairs said that south Korea is loudmouthed about the "blood relations" with the U.S., but the latter  handles the issue of the Korean peninsula within the framework of its world strategy. He asserted the U.S. should pull back its forces from south Korea, not wasting military expenses  on the Korean peninsula in which it is not vitally  interested as their presence there does not bring any profit to it. 
					 The expert warned that if the U.S. seeks to put the DPRK under its control, it will entail "horrible consequences."
					
					 This amounts to admitting that the U.S. forces' presence is nothing beneficial to both Korea and the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea was illegal from its start as they landed there quite contrary to the will and wishes of the Korean nation. Therefore, it was aimed at swallowing up the whole of Korea and dominating Asia.
					
					 The U.S. occupied south Korea under the pretext of "disarming" the Japanese imperialists to meet its aggressive interests in the middle of the last century, bisecting the nation and territory into two parts.
					
					 Owing to the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea the Koreans have suffered unimaginable misfortune and pain and horrible tragedies are taking place there even at this moment.
					
					 Their ceaseless drills for a nuclear war have turned the Korean peninsula and region into the biggest hotspot in the world.
					
					 The withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea is indispensable prerequisite to achieving the reunification of the Korean nation, peace and security in the region and the demand of mankind which was reflected in the resolution adopted at the 30th UN General Assembly.
					
					 The U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is not in line with the realistic interests of the U.S.
					
					 It is of criminal and anachronistic nature in the light of the demands of the Korean nation and the international community and the changed strategic structure in Northeast Asia and is nothing beneficial to the American empire either.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to properly face up to the trend of the times and make a decision to pull its forces from south Korea as early as possible.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Conservatives' Racket for "Declaration of Martial Law"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on S. Korean Conservatives' Racket for "Declaration of Martial Law"
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean ultra-right conservative forces are getting all the more reckless in their wild act against the public mindset.
					 Shortly ago, a group of conservative gangsters held a rally against the impeachment of Park Geun Hye where they called for "declaration of Martial Law" and swayed spears and helmets reminiscent of the "crusade".
					
					 They shouted "All Reds have to be removed", "Insurgents holding candlelight have to be killed under Martial Law" and "Only Martial Law will work. Army, rise up".
					
					 This rowdyism, reminding one of the bloody fascist violence in the days of the May 18 Kwangju resistance, touches off the surging wrath of all the fellow countrymen and the international community as it was pursuant to the puppet conservative forces' organized and planned plot to open a way-out of the on-going situation calling for the impeachment of Park.
					
					 The group of conservatives is making desperate efforts to prop up the declining conservative regime while defending the traitorous policy of Park, root cause of all disaster.
					
					 From the outset of the year, traitor Park instigated the conservative media to totally deny her crimes. And she, openly inciting military coup, let the puppet military gangsters float the story of "insecurity" and "threat from the north" in a bid to create the feelings of crisis in society on purpose.
					
					 She let the die-hard conservatives, who insulted the bereaved families of Sewol disaster as "corpse vendors" and branded progressive labor organizations as "forces following the north", trumpet about "nullification of impeachment" and "elimination of leftist forces" and vociferate about the "attempt of north-defending group to seize 'power'", threatening and blackmailing the people.
					
					 The move of the ultra-right conservative group to drench the whole south Korean land with blood in order to prolong the dirty remaining days of the "yusin" witch is a dangerous act that can be done only by the descendents of the military fascist dictators who mangled the April 19 popular uprising and the May 18 Kwangju resistance with bayonet.
					
					 The racket for "declaration of Martial Law" kicked up by the conservative group, repeating the great tragedy of history which turned south Korea into a theatre of fascism and wasteland of human rights and democracy, is a fin de siecle act of those without future.
					
					 The group of traitors can never check the dynamic advance of the people desirous of new politics and new society and can not evade the miserable fate of perishing in the sea of candlelight.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Blasts Ban Ki-moon's Incoherent Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Blasts Ban Ki-moon's Incoherent Remarks
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean online paper Voice of People carried an editorial on Feb. 1, blasting the incoherent politics of Ban Ki-moon.
					 The editorial said that the support rate for Ban is steadily sinking, adding that this is because he has not made his political view clear, failing to meet the public demand for the regime change.

articles.title: S. Korea: Puppet Regime's Suppression of Sport Circle Disclosed
articles.content:
S. Korea: Puppet Regime's Suppression of Sport Circle Disclosed
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- According to south Korea's paper Herald Economy, a parliamentary spokesperson for the opposition Kukmin Party on Jan. 31 exposed the fact that officials in the sports field were also put on the black list which was a means of suppressing the people in the field of literature and arts.
					 He said he confirmed the fact that such black list existed in the sports circle after meeting with ex-senior officials of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism on Jan. 30.

articles.title: Japanese Court's Ruling against Korean School Protested
articles.content:
Japanese Court's Ruling against Korean School Protested
 Tokyo, February 1 (KNS-KCNA) -- Members of the Osaka Korean School, Koreans in Japan and Japanese citizens protested against the Osaka district court's discriminative decision against the Korean school on Jan. 26. 
					 The school side held a press conference in protest against the court's decision.
					
					 Speakers denounced the suspension of payment of subsidies to the school as an extremely unfair action against the Korean schools and Korean students.
					
					 On the same day, Koreans in Osaka and Japanese citizens held a meeting in protest against the unreasonable ruling of the Osaka district court.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced by Romanian Party
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced by Romanian Party
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The New Socialist Party of Romania posted the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on its website "Juche Idea" on January 12 to celebrate his birth anniversary.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Iran
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Iran
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Islamic Coalition Party of Iran formed a preparatory committee for celebrating the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il on January 25.
					 Its vice general secretary for international affairs was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the days from January 25 to April 20 as a celebration period and decided to organize various political and cultural events praising the revolutionary careers and exploits of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu in the period.
					
					 It also decided to give wide publicity to the achievements made by the Korean army and people in building a socialist power under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star, birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, was formed in Russia on Jan. 23.
					 V. A. Petrov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events praising the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the said anniversaries.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Brazil
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Brazil
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A Brazilian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed on January 18.
					 Acilino Riveiro, chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il who is co-chairman of the International Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize such political and cultural events as celebration meeting, film show and photo and book exhibition praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his 75th birth anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre la Escuela Primaria de Internado de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre la Escuela Primaria de Internado de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Escuela Primaria de Internado de Pyongyang donde estan en el maximo nivel el ambiente pedagogico y las condiciones de vida. 
					En su recorrido por varios puntos inclusive el edificio escolar y el albergue, el se cercioro del estado de construccion de la escuela y los preparativos de su operacion. 
					
					Calificando de moderno y limpio el edificio escolar, dijo que todas las aulas se han hecho las multifuncionales e informatizadas conforme a las caracteristicas de la entidad de ensenanza primaria y en ellas hay suficientes equipamientos escolares de varios tipos.   
					
					Prosiguio que fueron acondicionadas con mucho empeno varias salas como la de educacion en el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il, la del cuerpo infantil, la de naturaleza y la de divulgacion de canciones y bailes. 
					
					En el pasillo estan pegados varios dibujos de contenido infantil que mantienen la visualidad, el caracter cientifico y la vivacidad y todo el espacio fue convertido en el hall de conocimientos elementales y de referencia, recalco.
					
					Asistio a una clase de lengua materna que se daba en el grupo no.1 del segundo ano y estudio en detalles con el afecto paternal el metodo didactico de maestra y el empleo de materiales didacticos, la capacidad cognoscitiva de los alumnos y la calidad de sus manuales y libretas. 
					
					Dijo que el albergue esta bien adornado conforme al estado psiquico infantil de los matriculados asegurando el confort de ellos y anadio que le gusta lo todo como dormitorio, comedor, barberia y sala de tratamiento. 
					
					La calidad de la educacion primaria y secundaria decide la de ensenanza general del pais incluyendo la educacion superior y el atajo a la potencia de talentos reside en el cumplimiento consecuente de la politica del partido de dar importancia a la ensenanza primaria y secundaria, subrayo y dio valiosas instrucciones que serviran de guia en la gestion de la escuela. 
					
					Los huerfanos no tienen otro tutor que nuestro partido, apunto y encomendo encarecidamente a los funcionarios, profesores y empleados de la escuela que atendieran bien, por su parte tambien, a los internados para que ellos crezcan honestos, vivarachos y alegres sin conocer la tristeza. 
					
					El mismo dia, el Maximo Dirigente se retrato con los matriculados, maestros y empleados de las Escuelas Primaria y Secundaria de Internado de Pyongyang y los constructores de las mismas. 
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, Jo Yong Won, subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, y Ma Won Chun, director de diseno del Comite de Estado.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Comite de Union Africana

Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Comite de Union Africana
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el 31 de enero un mensaje de felicitacion a Moussa Faki Mahamat, recien electo como presidente del Comite de la Union Africana en la 28a Cumbre de la UA. 
					El remitente senalo que la eleccion de Moussa Faki Mahamat testimonia la gran confianza y esperanza de los pueblos de los paises regionales que se esfuerzan por resolver por su propia cuenta el problema del continente sin ingerencia de las fuerzas externas y lograr la paz, la estabilidad y el desarrollo de Africa. 
					
					Reafirmo la firme posicion de la RPDC de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la UA y sus miembros y deseo de todo corazon grandes exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario por el fortalecimiento de la UA.

articles.title: Vocero del CRPP exige escuchar con seriedad el llamamiento patriotico de la RPDC
articles.content:
Vocero del CRPP exige escuchar con seriedad el llamamiento patriotico de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- En consonancia con el llamamiento del Ano Nuevo de la RPDC a abrir la ancha avenida de reunificacion independiente con la voluntad y fuerzas unidas de toda la nacion coreana, los compatriotas en el Norte, el Sur y ultramar desean unanimemente que se mejoren las relaciones intercoreanas y lleguen la paz y estabilidad a la Peninsula Coreana. 
					Adelanta asi el vocero del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria en su nota publicada la vispera y prosigue:
					
					Sin embargo, los titeres surcoreanos se entregan como de costumbre desde el comienzo del ano nuevo a los actos verbales conflictivos planteando la "desnuclearizacion del Norte" y el "problema de DDHH del Norte". 
					
					Casi todos los dias, reclaman la "firme disposicion" y "represalia efectiva" a la supuesta "amenaza proveniente del Norte" y "provocacion inimaginable" y libran por doquier los entrenamientos para la guerra de agresion al Norte. 
					
					Conocemos bien que ellos crean la "crisis de seguridad" dando destaque a la "amenaza y provocacion del Norte" con el objetivo de salvar el destino de Park Geun-hye caida en el callejon sin salida y eludir la actual crisis de su dimision. 
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas emprenden el camino de enfrentamiento y provocacion imprudentes para remediar la situacion critica de casa, eso se extendera al inimaginable choque y guerra y finalmente, al arruinamiento vergonzoso de si mismas. 
					
					Les tocaran la afrenta y verguenza mas grandes en el caso de que sigan siendo satelites de EE.UU. sin poder juzgar la situacion periferica en cambio brusco ni distinguir al verdadero enemigo principal de la nacion.
					
					Antes de que se haga tarde, ellas deben volverse en si y optar por forjar el destino nacional de manera independiente, esto es la demanda de toda la nacion y el ultimo consejo de la historia. 
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas se obstinan en la temeraria campana de enfrentamiento y guerra en adhesion a EE.UU. dando espaldas a la buena fe y llamamiento sincero de la RPDC, pasaran el limite la indulgencia y paciencia de esta y recaeran totalmente sobre ellas las consecuencias catastroficas que se produzcan en ese caso.

articles.title: CJC refuta sofisterias de EE.UU. que aboga por "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC
articles.content:
CJC refuta sofisterias de EE.UU. que aboga por "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada el dia 2 en relacion con que Estados Unidos lanza las sofisterias abogando por las "resoluciones de sancion" del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite de Juristas de Corea dio la respuesta como sigue:
					Todas las "resoluciones de sancion" anti-RPDC, inventadas hasta la fecha por EE.UU. y sus seguidores abusando del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, menospreciaron flagrantemente los derechos legitimos del Estado soberano y las leyes internacionales reconocidas, razon por la cual se revela mas su ilegalidad con el paso de los dias.
					
					Sobre todo, las "resoluciones de sancion" destinadas a bloquear el pais socialista provocan gran condena de la sociedad internacional porque ellas devienen el acto antietico y anti-civilizacion encaminado convertir la sociedad coreana en el mundo oscuro medieval negando totalmente los derechos del pueblo coreano a la subsistencia y al desarrollo y destruyendo la civilidad contemporanea.
					
					Ya el circulo juridico internacional ha reconocido el hecho de que las "resoluciones de sancion", aprobadas en el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, no tienen ningun fundamento juridico y devienen una grave violacion a los derechos legitimos de un Estado soberano y los principios universales de las relaciones internacionales, aclarados en la Carta de la ONU.
					
					En 1966, EE.UU. invento por primera vez en la historia de la ONU la "resolucion de sancion" No. 232 en virtud del articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU como una medida de venganza a Rodesia que declaro la independencia de Gran Bretana. Entonces, el circulo juridico internacional cuestiono fuertemente al abuso de autoridad del CS de la ONU, enumerando una tras otra las ilegalidades de aquella "resolucion de sancion".
					
					En relacion con que EE.UU. sigue inventando las "resoluciones" injustas abusando de la facultad del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU en desprecio a las leyes internacionales reconocidas, la RPDC demando al Secretariado de la ONU organizar en Nueva York o Ginebra un forum internacional de los especialistas en ley para aclarar el fundamento juridico de las "resoluciones de sancion".
					
					Pero, EE.UU. presento a unos personajes fingidos como especialistas en el problema de Corea, ignorantes de la ley internacional, para seguir presentando las sofisterias caducas de que el CS de la ONU puede tomar las medidas correspondientes si se decide una accion de un Estado determinado como amenaza a la paz segun el articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU y el CS puede dar las sanciones a la RPDC porque su retirada del Tratado de No Proliferacion no lo reconocen otros paises.
					
					El articulo 39 de la Carta de la ONU que determino la facultad general del CS de la ONU no puede ser un fundamento juridico de la "resolucion de sancion". Tambien, ninguna ley internacional estipulo como amenaza a la paz una prueba nuclear o un lanzamiento de satelite de un Estado determinado.
					
					Tambien, la retirada de la RPDC del Tratado de No Proliferacion fue legitima por pasar todos los procesos segun el articulo 10 del Tratado, y ningun parrafo del Tratado estipula que la retirada debe ser reconocida por otros paises.
					
					Las sofisterias de los llamados especialistas norteamericanos en el problema de Corea demuestran fehacientemente la necesidad de organizar un forum internacional de los especialistas juridicos para discutir oficialmente el fundamento legal de las "resoluciones de sancion".
					
					La ONU que habla tanto de la gobernacion constitucional y la observacion de los reglamentos internacionales debe organizar sin demora el foro en vez de dar espalda a la justa demanda de la RPDC, de manera que tiene que cumplir su responsabilidad y deber asumidos ante la sociedad internacional.
					
					El Comite de Juristas de Corea desea a la sociedad internacional y las entidades juridicas que aprecian la justicia y la verdad responder activamente a nuestra propuesta de organizar el foro internacional para debatir oficialmente la base juridica de las "resoluciones de sancion".
